openings.name: Caro-Kann Defense
openings.description: The Caro-Kann Defense is a solid defense to 1.e4. It features clear plans and is excellent for players who prefer structured positions.

variations.name: Main Line: Bf5 with h4-h5
variations.description: White pushes h4-h5 to restrict Black's bishop, but Black maintains solidity with ...Nd7 and ...e6.

variations.name: Karpov Variation (Nd7)
variations.description: Black avoids the bishop trade, aiming for a compact position with ...e6 and ...Be7.

variations.name: Smyslov Variation (gxf6)
variations.description: Similar to Bronstein-Larsen, but Black develops the bishop to f5 early, supporting ...e6.

variations.name: Tal Variation (h5 & Bg4)
variations.description: White plays f4 to support e5, while Black counters with ...h5 and ...Bg4, leading to a complex middlegame.

variations.name: Classical Advance (Bg4 & Qxb2)
variations.description: Black plays ...Bg4 and ...Qxb2, leading to a sharp position where both sides have chances.

variations.name: Breyer Variation (Bb5)
variations.description: The Breyer Variation features Bb5, leading to a solid structure for Black with ...Qa5 and ...Qb6.

variations.name: Gurgenidze System (dxc5)
variations.description: The Gurgenidze System allows for early ...Bg4, leading to a solid structure with ...e6.

variations.name: Modern Gurgenidze (Ne7-f5)
variations.description: The Modern Gurgenidze features ...Ne7 and ...Nf5, leading to a solid structure with potential for counterplay.

openings.name: Jobava London System
openings.description: The Jobava London System is a solid opening for white that is easy to learn and has a clear plan.

variations.name: Standard Setup
variations.description: The standard setup for the Jobava London System, where white develops pieces and prepares for a kingside attack.

variations.name: Jobava Gambit
variations.description: The Jobava Gambit is an aggressive line where white sacrifices a pawn for rapid development and attacking chances.
